author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Singer Sam Smith wants to be a figure in the gay community
text:
Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP Sam Smith wants to be an advocate for gay rights. Sam Smith has changed his tune on gay rights.
The "I'm Not The Only One" told Rolling Stone magazine said he hopes to be a "figure" in the gay community and wants to speak for "gay men."
"I sell records in countries where gay men get killed and that's a big thing for me, because maybe one person in that country will pick up my album, realize it's by a gay artist, and it might change their opinion."
Kevin Winter Singer Sam Smith announced he was gay in 2014. In 2014, shortly after he revealed to the public that he was gay, the British singer sparked controversy after he revealed to NME magazine he was "not trying to be a spokesperson" for gay rights.
In February, he released a video for "Lay Me Down," where he performed the ballad in front of what first seems to be mournful funeral, but turned out to be a celebration for a gay marriage. It was the first political statement made by the 23-year-old singer, who broke up with model Jonathan Zeizel in January.
